newsitem.title: DUBAI: Palestinians to hold trade fair in Dubai.
newsitem.headline: Palestinians to hold trade fair in Dubai.

text.p: Palestinians plan to display their national products at a trade fair in Dubai next March, their first abroad since Israel and the PLO signed an interim self-rule peace deal in 1993.
The Dubai Chamber of Industry and Trade, in a statement issued on Monday, also said Palestinians hoped to use the fair as a gateway for establishing trade links with other oil-rich Gulf Arab states.
Sixty top Palestinian manufacturers will take part in the week-long fair, starting on March 14, it added.

Ties between the PLO and all Gulf Arab states, except Kuwait, have improved over the past years from strains caused by its pro-Baghdad sympathy during the Gulf War, sparked by Iraq's August 1990 invasion of Kuwait.
